Model Agroscope
$$Y_{rel}\sim A*(1-e^{rate*P_{CO_2}+Env})$$

Wir ersetzen nur rate mit unserer Schätzung k:
$$Y_{rel}\sim A*(1-e^{k*P_{CO_2}+Env})$$

Sind unsere Modelparameter gute Prediktoren??
$$Y_{rel}\sim A*(1-e^{k*PS}+Env})$$

Es gibt noch die Kovariaten Niederschlag pro Jahr, Jahresdurchschnittstemperatur und Temperatur in Jugendphase



```{r}
#| echo: false





library(GGally)

ggpairs(nlme.coef.mrg, 
  aes(col=Site, size = Treatment), 
  columns = c("soil_0_20_P_AAE10", "soil_0_20_P_CO2", "PS", "k", "kPS"),
  shape = 2
  )




p6 <- ggplot(nlme.coef.mrg,aes(y=soil_0_20_P_AAE10, x=soil_0_20_P_CO2, col=Site, size = Treatment)) +
  geom_point(shape = 7) + 
  scale_x_log10() + scale_y_log10() +
  labs(x=TeX("$P_{H_2O10}(mg/kg Soil)$"),
         y=TeX("$P_{AAEDTA}(mg/kg Soil)$")); p6
  
p7 <- ggplot(nlme.coef.mrg,aes(y=PS, x=soil_0_20_P_CO2, col=Site, size = Treatment)) +
  geom_point(shape = 7) +
  scale_x_log10() + scale_y_log10() +
  labs(x=TeX("$P_{CO_2}(mg/kg Soil)$"),
         y=TeX("$PS(mg/kg Soil)$")); p7

p8 <- ggplot(nlme.coef.mrg,aes(y=k, x=soil_0_20_P_CO2, col=Site, size = Treatment)) +
  geom_point(shape = 7) +
  scale_x_log10() +
  labs(x=TeX("$P_{CO_2}(mg/kg Soil)$"),
         y=TeX("$k(1/s)$")); p8

p9 <- ggplot(nlme.coef.mrg,aes(y=k*PS, x=soil_0_20_P_CO2, col=Site, size = Treatment)) +
  geom_point(shape = 7) +
  scale_x_log10() + scale_y_log10() +
  labs(x=TeX("$P_{CO_2}(mg/kg Soil)$"),
         y=TeX("$v=k*PS(mg/s*kg Soil)$"));p9


p11 <- ggplot(nlme.coef.mrg,aes(y=PS, x=soil_0_20_P_AAE10, col=Site, size = Treatment)) +
  scale_x_log10() + scale_y_log10() +
  geom_point(shape = 7) +
  labs(x=TeX("$P_{AAEDTA}(mg/kg Soil)$"),
         y=TeX("$PS(mg/kg Soil)$")); p11

p12 <- ggplot(nlme.coef.mrg,aes(y=k, x=soil_0_20_P_AAE10, col=Site, size = Treatment)) +
  geom_point(shape = 7) +
   scale_x_log10() + scale_y_log10() +
  labs(x=TeX("$P_{AAEDTA}(mg/kg Soil)$"),
         y=TeX("$k(1/s)$"))

p12

p13 <- ggplot(nlme.coef.mrg,aes(y=k*PS, x=soil_0_20_P_AAE10, col=Site, size = Treatment)) +
  geom_point(shape = 7) +
  labs(x=TeX("$P_{AAEDTA}(mg/kg Soil)$"),
         y=TeX("$v=k*PS(mg/s*kg Soil)$"))

p13


p14 <- ggplot(nlme.coef.mrg,aes(y=sqrt(k*PS), x=soil_0_20_P_AAE10, col=Site, size = Treatment)) +
  geom_point(shape = 7) +
  labs(x=TeX("$P_{AAEDTA}(mg/kg Soil)$"),
         y=TeX("$\\sqrt{v}=(k*PS)^{0.5}(mg/s*kg Soil)$"))


p14
```

Nun noch die Linearen Regressionen, die ausstehend sind:

```{r}
# Wovon hängen Modelparameter ab?
library(asbio)



partial.resid.plot(fit.PS)
partial.resid.plot(fit.k)
partial.resid.plot(fit.kPS)

vif(fit.k)

fit.PS       <- lm(log(PS)       ~ soil_0_20_clay+ soil_0_20_pH_H2O + soil_0_20_Corg + soil_0_20_silt + fert_P_tot, nlme.coef.mrg)
fit.k        <- lm(k             ~ soil_0_20_clay+ soil_0_20_pH_H2O + soil_0_20_Corg + soil_0_20_silt + fert_P_tot, nlme.coef.mrg)
fit.kPS      <- lm(I(log(k*PS)) ~ soil_0_20_clay+ soil_0_20_pH_H2O + soil_0_20_Corg + soil_0_20_silt + fert_P_tot, nlme.coef.mrg)

fit.Yrel     <- lm(Ymain_rel         ~ k * log(PS) + Treatment, nlme.coef.mrg)
fit.Puptake  <- lm(annual_P_uptake   ~ k * log(PS) + Treatment + Site, nlme.coef.mrg)

Anova(fit.PS)
#summary(glht(fit.PS))
# Fazit: PS wird von treatment stark beeinfluss, k eher nicht (dafür von site)
Anova(fit.k)
summary(glht(fit.k))
Anova(fit.kPS)
summary(glht(fit.kPS))
Anova(fit.Yrel)
Anova(fit.Puptake)

# Verhalten der Modelparameter und Ertragsdaten auf P-CO2 und P-AAE10

# fit.PS       <- lm(PS            ~ soil_0_20_P_CO2 + soil_0_20_P_AAE10, nlme.coef.mrg)
fit.PS       <- lm(log(PS)       ~ log(soil_0_20_P_CO2) + log(soil_0_20_P_AAE10), nlme.coef.mrg)
fit.k        <- lm(k             ~ log(soil_0_20_P_CO2) + log(soil_0_20_P_AAE10), nlme.coef.mrg)
fit.kPS      <- lm(I(log(k*PS)) ~ log(soil_0_20_P_CO2) + log(soil_0_20_P_AAE10), nlme.coef.mrg)
fit.Yrel     <- lm(Ymain_rel         ~ log(soil_0_20_P_CO2) + log(soil_0_20_P_AAE10) + fert_P_tot, nlme.coef.mrg)
fit.Puptake  <- lm(annual_P_uptake   ~ soil_0_20_P_CO2 + soil_0_20_P_AAE10 + fert_P_tot, nlme.coef.mrg)

hist(nlme.coef.mrg$Ymain_rel)
hist(nlme.coef.mrg$annual_P_uptake)

Anova(fit.PS)
#summary(glht(fit.PS))
# Fazit: PS wird von treatment stark beeinfluss, k eher nicht (dafür von site)
Anova(fit.k)
summary(glht(fit.k))
Anova(fit.kPS)
summary(glht(fit.kPS))
Anova(fit.Yrel)
Anova(fit.Puptake)



```
